      === Future Monthly Return Bound (Monitoring) ===
      Lower Bound (monthly, 99% confidence): -16.46534500%    [Block length L = 4]
      What this means: With about 99% confidence, any future month is expected to be no worse than -16.46534500%.
      How we estimated it: We used a block bootstrap with L = 4 to respect typical month-to-month dependence.
      We then looked at the 5th percentile of monthly returns and applied a BCa confidence interval.
      The number shown above is the **lower endpoint** of that interval (a conservative bound).
      Data used: 90 monthly returns  |  Bootstrap resamples: 25000  |  Confidence level: 99%
      Interpretation guide:
       • If this bound is well above 0%, downside months are usually mild.
       • If it’s near/below 0%, expect occasional negative months of that size.
       • Larger L assumes stronger serial dependence; smaller L assumes less.
      Losing-streak bound @ 95.00000000% CL: observed=5, upper bound=6 (trades)

      === Recommended Position Sizing (AMZN) ===
      Asset Type:        Standard Asset (1x)
      Execution Mode:    Standard Margin (2:1 Buying Power)
      --------------------------------------------------
      Strategy Max Drawdown (95% Conf): 20.04%
      Your Max Account Risk Tolerance:  20.00%
      --------------------------------------------------
      1. Regulatory Limit: 200.00% (Legal Broker Limit)
      2. Risk Limit:       99.79% (Your Safety Limit)
      --------------------------------------------------
      RECOMMENDED TOTAL ALLOCATION: 99.79% of Account Equity
      SIZE PER TRADE (4 total):    24.95% of Account Equity
      --------------------------------------------------
      [Beginner's Guide to Standard Margin]
      • This is a standard stock/ETF. To maximize returns, we use 'Regulation T' leverage.
      • 'Reg T' allows you to hold $2 of stock for every $1 of cash you have.
        (e.g. If you have $10,000, you can hold $20,000 of positions).
      • You are borrowing the difference from your broker. This requires a 'Margin Account'.
      • You will pay a small amount of daily interest on the borrowed part, but
        for short-term trades (days), this cost is negligible compared to profit potential.
      * Note: Sizing reduced below broker limits to match your risk tolerance.
      --------------------------------------------------
      Costs assumed: $0 commission, 0.10% slippage/spread per side (≈0.20% round-trip).
